ch.ethz.csb.youscope.shared.measurement.callback
Interface MeasurementCallbackProvider

All Superinterfaces:
java.rmi.Remote
public interface MeasurementCallbackProvider
extends java.rmi.Remote

A measurement callback provider can be used by a measurement to gain control over functionality at creation time. Typically, it is used by measurements (which run on the YouScope's server) to be able to trigger certain behavior on the client side, e.g. to wait for a certain user input. The client therefore passes the provider to the server when creating a new measurement. Measurements or jobs can than ask the provider for a certain functionality, represented by an interface. If the functionality is available, an object implementing the interface is returned, which can be used for communication proposes. Note that the structure of YouScope discourages the use of such callbacks. In general, measurements should be run without user interaction, or even without any client connected (the client can disconnect after starting a measurement, and the measurement should continue to run). However, for certain use cases callbacks are necessary, but the respective measurement is then responsible to check the availability of the callback, provide certain default behavior, and also include appropriate methods for the case that a client disconnects certainly during a measurement. Furthermore, a callback interface should be defined general, i.e. be not dependent on a certain type of client, and in no case be used to obtain direct control over the client. On the other hand, the client should not directly communicate with the microscope during a measurement. A typical usecase would thus be that the measurement takes an image and sends it via the callback to the client. The implementation of the callback querries the user in one or the other way about certain properties of the image, e.g. if the quality is good enough. The callback implementation then just returns the answer to the measurement (e.g. a boolean value).

Author:
Moritz Lang

Method Detail

getMeasurementCallback

<T extends MeasurementCallback> T getMeasurementCallback(java.lang.Class<T> callbackInterface)
                                                     throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                                                            MeasurementCallbackException
Returns a callback implementing the provided interface. Note that provided callback definition must be an interface, and not a class (otherwise a MeasurementCallbackException is thrown). Note that it should not be assumed that the returned interface corresponds to a certain implementation, but that an arbitrary callback implementing the given interface might be returned. Throws a MeasurementCallbackException if a callback implementing the interface is not available.

Type Parameters:
T - Interface of the requested callback.
Parameters:
callbackInterface - Interface definition. Must not be a class.
Returns:
The requested callback.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException
MeasurementCallbackException

hasCallback

boolean hasCallback(java.lang.Class<? extends MeasurementCallback> callbackInterface)
                    throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                           MeasurementCallbackException
Checks if a given callback type is available. Allways returns false if provided definition is an interface and not a class.

Parameters:
callbackInterface - Interface definition. Must not be a class.
Returns:
True if callback is available.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException
MeasurementCallbackException
